comment.body: @Nora: Hover over your comment/post, press the pencil icon, then you will see the delete button
it's not in the works yet
@Border0464fred: Both possible, so you will able to opt-out DHT if you want.

- Download a bitcoin wallet software, eg.: https://electrum.org
- Wallet > Private keys > Import
- Enter your site's private key (if you cloned it it can be found in data/users.json)
- That's it, it will notify you if you have new transaction and you can spend it via the send tab
@Whacko: I could be possible, but I have not through about it yet.
@Loligod: Translation plugin released 2 months ago
Simple ZeroNet sites that stores the people's posts, comments, votes. You can simply create your own hub by cloning any of the current ones.

@Jjg: By default ZeroNet site are only modifiable by it's owner, but it's possible to define directory where other people able to submit his/her own content. (like comments on your blog)
ZeroMe profiles are stored in this user-modifiable area on a hub site.

@Jjg: By default ZeroNet sites has 10MB limit. To avoid this limit, the user data on ZeroMe is stored in hub sites. This way you will only download and receive updates for profiles you are interested in: the hub sites you have added in your client.
For most of the other sites (eg. ZeroTalk, ZeroBlog) 10MB limit is enough, so the data is stored directly on the site.
You have to sign the data/users/content.json file: Open the sidebar, enter `data/users/content.json` to the bottom, press sign, then publish

It's up to the site/hub owner.
They can remove the content they don't want to see, but moderating a network that offers anonymity is harder than clearnet, since your internet identity is not connected to content at all.
I had removed the problematic content from ZeroMe hubs I created (Orage/Blue/Red/Green), but there are other hubs I have no control.
The freedom has downsides and It's not for everyone. If you decides to visit an uncensored network you have to prepare for that kind of things, but it will improve with time when the site/hub owners will take more time to managing their site.
@Journalist: If you support decentralization, then there is no place for "only official hubs".
@Journalist: Like I said I have no control over that hub, so you should ask this from the hub operator.

It uses ssl if possible, but some client has broken openssl, so it's not possible. Even if you use ssl it's still possible to decrypt the data with active ssl proxy, because the certs are self-signed. (so MITM can see your data)
But since every data on zeronet is verified on client side (by ECC or SHA512) modification of this data is not possible by MITM and by that the broken transport layer security is not a big problem for ZeroNet.
Tor .onion connections solves this problem, they totally MITM safe.
Have you tried to restart you client?
@Rythyrix: Can you please give me one failed file? Go to ZeroMail, open the sidebar and you will see the list in the missing files section.
@Rythyrix: Thanks for the files, it would help if you could upload ~10 lines before and after a "this file is archived!" log entry from the more detailed log/debug.log file.

Similar to clearnet: The site owner can ban/remove user based on zeroid identifier.
I don't see how would blockchain solve this problem. Other easy solution would be shared ignore lists.
these informations not timestamped/logged yet, but could be possible in the future

Thanks, updated the tutorial on medium.com.
As for the error: looks like for some unknown reasons there is an inconsistency between the "content.db" cache and the real file system.
I testing a fix for it, but try to create the "data/users/14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy/content.json" file manually with the content "{}"
@Glightstar: Try press Reload the Rebuild button on the sidebar.

You need to add an "optional" regex pattern to the content.json and zeronet will handles the rest.
eg.: `"optional": "(?!avatar).*jpg",` [in zerome's user files](merged-ZeroMe/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/data/users/1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj/content.json) means every jpg file in user directory is optional file except avatar.jpg
Yes, currently there is no global way, you need to add it to the content.json file you will use to sign the files.

If the json file is valid and same as other user's then it should update the date_added correctly.
Can you give link to your bot's data.json file?
@Binchan: It's a simple misspelling: you need `date_added`, but you have dat**a**_added in the file
There was an error related to the port checking. It's fixed in Rev2088, so updating to that version probably fixes the error.

What does OpenSSL verify line says on http:/127.0.0.1:43110/Benchmark page?
Do you have `ssl*`, `crypto*`, `libcrypto*` file in /storage/emulated/0/lib dir?
Probably compiling and bundling openssl libs with ZeroNet-kivy would be the solution. It would also reduce the cpu usage of the verification of the files by 20 times.
@P2P: I was able to reproduce the problem (in VMWare + RemixOS 3.0) and I think this commit will fix it: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/commit/f30b2b6fc2b799d0bd3e1e81b68634bb1418af61

Some ideas if we want to spend it:
 - Get audit from professional security firm.
 - Create bug-bounty. (Actually I already sent some bounty for bug reporters)
 - Hire someone for specific task
 - Create ZeroNet site contest and support content creators

There is a bit more peer than usual, but I don't see any suspicious thing.
It's an opensource protocol/app, so you can't do much about making custom modifications, but I don't see any problem with that. If someone does not have spare bandwidth to seed sites, then he/she can use a proxy or simply put it on paused state.
@Kaffie: Thanks for the feedback, I'm totally up to this,here is the discussion: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1026
It automatically group it by title, so I recommend using "New comment" as title and username to the body

@Binchan: It's using pyhon search engine https://docs.python.org/2/library/re.html
@Git Center: Why do you want to change it? It allows the space character.
@Binchan: Since 0.6.0 the valid path is `"^[a-z\[\]\(\) A-Z0-9_@=\.\+-/]+$"`, so it's includes `" "`, but not other whitespace characters

@Binchan: Not yet. The json files are written by the site's javascript source code, so the client itself can't modify it's content. Maybe it could be solved by adding a placeholder for the timestamp, eg. `{{ publish_timestamp }}`, but not sure if it's necessary.
data/users.json settings node within site's part
Yeah, great idea, added to TODO :)

It was more tricky, than I originally thought, but added in Rev3176. To take advantage you should have your directory in the ignore pattern followed by `/.*`. So having `data/users/.*` as your ignore pattern will be fast, but `data/users/.*/.*` or `data/users` won't.
Yeah, nice spot, object arguments not supported on that call
Yes, currently you can't share a file named content.json file, as a standard file. I will think about how to solve it...
It stores your selected profile in browser's local storage (similar to cookies)

I also got lots of reach from ICO projects, but I decided to keep the project indepentent from third-party money.
If there is a reason I'm happy to use the donated bitcoins to support zeronet-related projects, but I'm not sure if money has positible effect on open source projects. Also I prefer if somone developing something on moral motivates instead of financial.

@Version: Yes, it's legal here. They tried to ban the encrypted communication 2 years ago (https://www.deepdotweb.com/2016/05/16/hungary-passes-new-law-to-ban-full-encryption/), but it did not passed.
There will be elections next month, probably the current (not-so liberal) ruling party will win for the 3rd time in row. I expect it to be worse after that.
I have just increased the optional limit to 100MB/user
Do you have normal amount (100+) of peers for the site? Do you see tls-rsa encrypted connections on /Stats page?
@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: yes: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Stats
That error means there is no connected peers. You can ignore it

@Binchan: It's the same problem: there is no peers connected to your client. (You can verify it using the http://127.0.0.1:43110/Stats)
The client tries to keep 6 connection per site by default. Do you have lines "Need connections:" in your log/debug.log file? (there should be one for each site in every 5 minute)

@1pgallery: According to the error you have lots of content.json files in your site. The sidebar calls `site.content_manager.listContents()` which should return the list of non-user content.json files. (normally its just a few for every site) It's possible to fix the query, but do you really need this large ammount of content.json files?

I have fixed both, but on ZeroMail I recommend to delete earlier sent messages if you run out of the space.
@Styromaniac: You can delete your sent messages, but not the incoming ones (since they are stored in other user's data file)

The posts are timestamped based on the machine time. There is a feature that calculates the possible correct time based on the connected peers time, but right now it's only give notification your time is more than 10 minutes off. It could be possible to add a feature to ZeroTalk (and other sites) that uses this to correct the smaller time differences.
what do you mean by instability? the client crashes or other type of problems?

Btw right now for me it's looks like china is detecting/filtering ZeroNet based on p2p behavior, so I think dht would be also detected.

It should be fixed now, but you have to untick/tick "Follow username mentions" in ZeroMe 3dot menu
After that it will display the post creator username at the beginning of the post
